CreateInvocation.name: CreateInvocation
CreateInvocation.documentation:
Creates a new invocation within a session. An invocation groups the related invocation steps that store the content from a conversation. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

Related APIs

  • ListInvocations

  • ListSessions

  • GetSession

CreateSession.name: CreateSession
CreateSession.documentation:
Creates a session to temporarily store conversations for generative AI (GenAI) applications built with open-source frameworks such as LangGraph and LlamaIndex. Sessions enable you to save the state of conversations at checkpoints, with the added security and infrastructure of Amazon Web Services. For more information, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

By default, Amazon Bedrock uses Amazon Web Services-managed keys for session encryption, including session metadata, or you can use your own KMS key. For more information, see Amazon Bedrock session encryption.

You use a session to store state and conversation history for generative AI applications built with open-source frameworks. For Amazon Bedrock Agents, the service automatically manages conversation context and associates them with the agent-specific sessionId you specify in the InvokeAgent API operation.

Related APIs:

  • ListSessions

  • GetSession

  • EndSession

  • DeleteSession

DeleteAgentMemory.name: DeleteAgentMemory
DeleteAgentMemory.documentation: Deletes memory from the specified memory identifier.

DeleteSession.name: DeleteSession
DeleteSession.documentation: Deletes a session that you ended. You can't delete a session with an ACTIVE status. To delete an active session, you must first end it with the EndSession API operation. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

EndSession.name: EndSession
EndSession.documentation: Ends the session. After you end a session, you can still access its content but you canâ€™t add to it. To delete the session and it's content, you use the DeleteSession API operation. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

GenerateQuery.name: GenerateQuery
GenerateQuery.documentation: Generates an SQL query from a natural language query. For more information, see Generate a query for structured data in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

GetAgentMemory.name: GetAgentMemory
GetAgentMemory.documentation: Gets the sessions stored in the memory of the agent.

GetExecutionFlowSnapshot.name: GetExecutionFlowSnapshot
GetExecutionFlowSnapshot.documentation:
Retrieves the flow definition snapshot used for a flow execution. The snapshot represents the flow metadata and definition as it existed at the time the execution was started. Note that even if the flow is edited after an execution starts, the snapshot connected to the execution remains unchanged.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

GetFlowExecution.name: GetFlowExecution
GetFlowExecution.documentation: Retrieves details about a specific flow execution, including its status, start and end times, and any errors that occurred during execution.

GetInvocationStep.name: GetInvocationStep
GetInvocationStep.documentation: Retrieves the details of a specific invocation step within an invocation in a session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

GetSession.name: GetSession
GetSession.documentation: Retrieves details about a specific session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

InvokeAgent.name: InvokeAgent
InvokeAgent.documentation:
Sends a prompt for the agent to process and respond to. Note the following fields for the request:

  • To continue the same conversation with an agent, use the same sessionId value in the request.

  • To activate trace enablement, turn enableTrace to true. Trace enablement helps you follow the agent's reasoning process that led it to the information it processed, the actions it took, and the final result it yielded. For more information, see Trace enablement.

  • End a conversation by setting endSession to true.

  • In the sessionState object, you can include attributes for the session or prompt or, if you configured an action group to return control, results from invocation of the action group.

The response contains both chunk and trace attributes.

The final response is returned in the bytes field of the chunk object. The InvokeAgent returns one chunk for the entire interaction.

  • The attribution object contains citations for parts of the response.

  • If you set enableTrace to true in the request, you can trace the agent's steps and reasoning process that led it to the response.

  • If the action predicted was configured to return control, the response returns parameters for the action, elicited from the user, in the returnControl field.

  • Errors are also surfaced in the response.

InvokeFlow.name: InvokeFlow
InvokeFlow.documentation:
Invokes an alias of a flow to run the inputs that you specify and return the output of each node as a stream. If there's an error, the error is returned. For more information, see Test a flow in Amazon Bedrock in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

The CLI doesn't support streaming operations in Amazon Bedrock, including InvokeFlow.

InvokeInlineAgent.name: InvokeInlineAgent
InvokeInlineAgent.documentation:
Invokes an inline Amazon Bedrock agent using the configurations you provide with the request.

  • Specify the following fields for security purposes.

    • (Optional) customerEncryptionKeyArn â€“ The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS key to encrypt the creation of the agent.

    • (Optional) idleSessionTTLinSeconds â€“ Specify the number of seconds for which the agent should maintain session information. After this time expires, the subsequent InvokeInlineAgent request begins a new session.

  • To override the default prompt behavior for agent orchestration and to use advanced prompts, include a promptOverrideConfiguration object. For more information, see Advanced prompts.

  • The agent instructions will not be honored if your agent has only one knowledge base, uses default prompts, has no action group, and user input is disabled.

ListFlowExecutionEvents.name: ListFlowExecutionEvents
ListFlowExecutionEvents.documentation:
Lists events that occurred during a flow execution. Events provide detailed information about the execution progress, including node inputs and outputs, flow inputs and outputs, condition results, and failure events.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

ListFlowExecutions.name: ListFlowExecutions
ListFlowExecutions.documentation:
Lists all executions of a flow. Results can be paginated and include summary information about each execution, such as status, start and end times, and the execution's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

ListInvocationSteps.name: ListInvocationSteps
ListInvocationSteps.documentation: Lists all invocation steps associated with a session and optionally, an invocation within the session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

ListInvocations.name: ListInvocations
ListInvocations.documentation: Lists all invocations associated with a specific session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

ListSessions.name: ListSessions
ListSessions.documentation: Lists all sessions in your Amazon Web Services account. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: List all the tags for the resource you specify.

OptimizePrompt.name: OptimizePrompt
OptimizePrompt.documentation: Optimizes a prompt for the task that you specify. For more information, see Optimize a prompt in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

PutInvocationStep.name: PutInvocationStep
PutInvocationStep.documentation:
Add an invocation step to an invocation in a session. An invocation step stores fine-grained state checkpoints, including text and images, for each interaction. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

Related APIs:

  • GetInvocationStep

  • ListInvocationSteps

  • ListInvocations

  • ListSessions

Rerank.name: Rerank
Rerank.documentation: Reranks the relevance of sources based on queries. For more information, see Improve the relevance of query responses with a reranker model.

Retrieve.name: Retrieve
Retrieve.documentation: Queries a knowledge base and retrieves information from it.

RetrieveAndGenerate.name: RetrieveAndGenerate
RetrieveAndGenerate.documentation: Queries a knowledge base and generates responses based on the retrieved results and using the specified foundation model or inference profile. The response only cites sources that are relevant to the query.

RetrieveAndGenerateStream.name: RetrieveAndGenerateStream
RetrieveAndGenerateStream.documentation:
Queries a knowledge base and generates responses based on the retrieved results, with output in streaming format.

The CLI doesn't support streaming operations in Amazon Bedrock, including InvokeModelWithResponseStream.

This operation requires permission for the bedrock:RetrieveAndGenerate action.

StartFlowExecution.name: StartFlowExecution
StartFlowExecution.documentation:
Starts an execution of an Amazon Bedrock flow. Unlike flows that run until completion or time out after five minutes, flow executions let you run flows asynchronously for longer durations. Flow executions also yield control so that your application can perform other tasks.

This operation returns an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that you can use to track and manage your flow execution.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

StopFlowExecution.name: StopFlowExecution
StopFlowExecution.documentation: Stops an Amazon Bedrock flow's execution. This operation prevents further processing of the flow and changes the execution status to Aborted.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Associate tags with a resource. For more information, see Tagging resources in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

UpdateSession.name: UpdateSession
UpdateSession.documentation: Updates the metadata or encryption settings of a session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

payload.documentation: The JSON or YAML-formatted payload defining the OpenAPI schema for the action group.

s3.documentation: Contains details about the S3 object containing the OpenAPI schema for the action group.

APISchema.documentation: Contains details about the OpenAPI schema for the action group. For more information, see Action group OpenAPI schemas. You can either include the schema directly in the payload field or you can upload it to an S3 bucket and specify the S3 bucket location in the s3 field.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: The request is denied because of missing access permissions. Check your permissions and retry your request.

customControl.documentation: To return the action group invocation results directly in the InvokeInlineAgent response, specify RETURN_CONTROL.

lambda.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function containing the business logic that is carried out upon invoking the action.

ActionGroupExecutor.documentation: Contains details about the Lambda function containing the business logic that is carried out upon invoking the action or the custom control method for handling the information elicited from the user.

apiPath.documentation: The path to the API to call, based off the action group.

executionType.documentation: How fulfillment of the action is handled. For more information, see Handling fulfillment of the action.

function.documentation: The function in the action group to call.

invocationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the invocation. Only returned if the executionType is RETURN_CONTROL.

parameters.documentation: The parameters in the Lambda input event.

requestBody.documentation: The parameters in the request body for the Lambda input event.

verb.documentation: The API method being used, based off the action group.

ActionGroupInvocationInput.documentation: Contains information about the action group being invoked. For more information about the possible structures, see the InvocationInput tab in OrchestrationTrace in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

metadata.documentation: Contains information about the action group output.

text.documentation: The JSON-formatted string returned by the API invoked by the action group.

ActionGroupInvocationOutput.documentation: Contains the JSON-formatted string returned by the API invoked by the action group.

actionGroupExecutor.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function containing the business logic that is carried out upon invoking the action or the custom control method for handling the information elicited from the user.

actionGroupName.documentation: The name of the action group.

apiSchema.documentation: Contains either details about the S3 object containing the OpenAPI schema for the action group or the JSON or YAML-formatted payload defining the schema. For more information, see Action group OpenAPI schemas.

description.documentation: A description of the action group.

functionSchema.documentation: Contains details about the function schema for the action group or the JSON or YAML-formatted payload defining the schema.

parentActionGroupSignature.documentation:
Specify a built-in or computer use action for this action group. If you specify a value, you must leave the description, apiSchema, and actionGroupExecutor fields empty for this action group.

  • To allow your agent to request the user for additional information when trying to complete a task, set this field to AMAZON.UserInput.

  • To allow your agent to generate, run, and troubleshoot code when trying to complete a task, set this field to AMAZON.CodeInterpreter.

  • To allow your agent to use an Anthropic computer use tool, specify one of the following values.

    Computer use is a new Anthropic Claude model capability (in beta) available with Anthropic Claude 3.7 Sonnet and Claude 3.5 Sonnet v2 only. When operating computer use functionality, we recommend taking additional security precautions, such as executing computer actions in virtual environments with restricted data access and limited internet connectivity. For more information, see Configure an Amazon Bedrock Agent to complete tasks with computer use tools.

    • ANTHROPIC.Computer - Gives the agent permission to use the mouse and keyboard and take screenshots.

    • ANTHROPIC.TextEditor - Gives the agent permission to view, create and edit files.

    • ANTHROPIC.Bash - Gives the agent permission to run commands in a bash shell.

parentActionGroupSignatureParams.documentation:
The configuration settings for a computer use action.

Computer use is a new Anthropic Claude model capability (in beta) available with Claude 3.7 Sonnet and Claude 3.5 Sonnet v2 only. For more information, see Configure an Amazon Bedrock Agent to complete tasks with computer use tools.

AgentActionGroup.documentation: Contains details of the inline agent's action group.

text.documentation: Input text.

AgentCollaboratorInputPayload.documentation: Input for an agent collaborator. The input can be text or an action invocation result.

input.documentation: Text or action invocation result input for the collaborator.

metadata.documentation: Contains information about the output from the agent collaborator.

text.documentation: Text output.

AgentCollaboratorOutputPayload.documentation: Output from an agent collaborator. The output can be text or an action invocation result.

message.documentation: A message describing the analysis of the prompt.

AnalyzePromptEvent.documentation: An event in which the prompt was analyzed in preparation for optimization.

actionGroup.documentation: The action group that the API operation belongs to.

actionInvocationType.documentation: Contains information about the API operation to invoke.

httpMethod.documentation: The HTTP method of the API operation.

parameters.documentation: The parameters to provide for the API request, as the agent elicited from the user.

requestBody.documentation: The request body to provide for the API request, as the agent elicited from the user.

ApiInvocationInput.documentation:
Contains information about the API operation that the agent predicts should be called.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • In the returnControl field of the InvokeAgent response

ApiParameter.documentation:
Information about a parameter to provide to the API request.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • InvokeAgent response

content.documentation: The content of the request body. The key of the object in this field is a media type defining the format of the request body.

ApiRequestBody.documentation:
The request body to provide for the API request, as the agent elicited from the user.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • InvokeAgent response

actionGroup.documentation: The action group that the API operation belongs to.

confirmationState.documentation: Controls the API operations or functions to invoke based on the user confirmation.

httpMethod.documentation: The HTTP method for the API operation.

httpStatusCode.documentation: http status code from API execution response (for example: 200, 400, 500).

responseBody.documentation: The response body from the API operation. The key of the object is the content type (currently, only TEXT is supported). The response may be returned directly or from the Lambda function.

responseState.documentation: Controls the final response state returned to end user when API/Function execution failed. When this state is FAILURE, the request would fail with dependency failure exception. When this state is REPROMPT, the API/function response will be sent to model for re-prompt

ApiResult.documentation:
Contains information about the API operation that was called from the action group and the response body that was returned.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • In the returnControlInvocationResults of the InvokeAgent request

citations.documentation: A list of citations and related information for a part of an agent response.

Attribution.documentation: Contains citations for a part of an agent response.

resourceName.documentation: The name of the dependency that caused the issue, such as Amazon Bedrock, Lambda, or STS.

BadGatewayException.documentation: There was an issue with a dependency due to a server issue. Retry your request.

numberOfResults.documentation: The number of results to return after reranking.

BedrockRerankingConfiguration.documentation: Contains configurations for an Amazon Bedrock reranker model.

additionalModelRequestFields.documentation: A JSON object whose keys are request fields for the model and whose values are values for those fields.

text.documentation: The text in the invocation step.

BedrockSessionContentBlock.documentation:
A block of content that you pass to, or receive from, a Amazon Bedrock session in an invocation step. You pass the content to a session in the payLoad of the PutInvocationStep API operation. You retrieve the content with the GetInvocationStep API operation.

For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

contentType.documentation: The MIME type of the document contained in the wrapper object.

data.documentation: The byte value of the file to upload, encoded as a Base-64 string.

identifier.documentation: The file name of the document contained in the wrapper object.

ByteContentDoc.documentation: This property contains the document to chat with, along with its attributes.

data.documentation: The raw bytes of the file to attach. The maximum size of all files that is attached is 10MB. You can attach a maximum of 5 files.

mediaType.documentation: The MIME type of data contained in the file used for chat.

ByteContentFile.documentation: The property contains the file to chat with, along with its attributes.

retrievedReferences.documentation: Contains metadata about the sources cited for the generated response.

Citation.documentation:
An object containing a segment of the generated response that is based on a source in the knowledge base, alongside information about the source.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • InvokeAgent response â€“ in the citations field

  • RetrieveAndGenerate response â€“ in the citations field

citation.deprecatedMessage: Citation is deprecated. Please use GeneratedResponsePart and RetrievedReferences for citation event.

generatedResponsePart.documentation: The generated response to the citation event.

retrievedReferences.documentation: The retrieved references of the citation event.

code.documentation: The code for the code interpreter to use.

files.documentation: Files that are uploaded for code interpreter to use.

CodeInterpreterInvocationInput.documentation: Contains information about the code interpreter being invoked.

executionError.documentation: Contains the error returned from code execution.

executionOutput.documentation: Contains the successful output returned from code execution

executionTimeout.documentation: Indicates if the execution of the code timed out.

files.documentation: Contains output files, if generated by code execution.

metadata.documentation: Contains information about the output from the code interpreter.

CodeInterpreterInvocationOutput.documentation: Contains the JSON-formatted string returned by the API invoked by the code interpreter.

actionGroups.documentation: List of action groups with each action group defining tasks the inline collaborator agent needs to carry out.

agentCollaboration.documentation: Defines how the inline supervisor agent handles information across multiple collaborator agents to coordinate a final response.

agentName.documentation: Name of the inline collaborator agent which must be the same name as specified for collaboratorName.

customerEncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS KMS key that encrypts the inline collaborator.

foundationModel.documentation: The foundation model used by the inline collaborator agent.

guardrailConfiguration.documentation: Details of the guardwrail associated with the inline collaborator.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation:
The number of seconds for which the Amazon Bedrock keeps information about the user's conversation with the inline collaborator agent.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Bedrock deletes any data provided before the timeout.

instruction.documentation: Instruction that tell the inline collaborator agent what it should do and how it should interact with users.

knowledgeBases.documentation: Knowledge base associated with the inline collaborator agent.

promptOverrideConfiguration.documentation: Contains configurations to override prompt templates in different parts of an inline collaborator sequence. For more information, see Advanced prompts.

agentAliasArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the inline collaborator agent.

collaboratorInstruction.documentation: Instructions that tell the inline collaborator agent what it should do and how it should interact with users.

collaboratorName.documentation: Name of the inline collaborator agent which must be the same name as specified for agentName.

relayConversationHistory.documentation: A relay conversation history for the inline collaborator agent.

CollaboratorConfiguration.documentation: Settings of an inline collaborator agent.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the condition node that evaluated the conditions.

satisfiedConditions.documentation: A list of conditions that were satisfied during the evaluation.

timestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the condition evaluation occurred.

ConditionResultEvent.documentation:
Contains information about a condition evaluation result during a flow execution. This event is generated when a condition node in the flow evaluates its conditions.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

ConflictException.documentation: There was a conflict performing an operation. Resolve the conflict and retry your request.

text.documentation: The block's text.

images.documentation: Lists details, including format and source, for the image in the response from the function call. You can specify only one image and the function in the returnControlInvocationResults must be a computer use action. For more information, see Configure an Amazon Bedrock Agent to complete tasks with computer use tools.

ContentBody.documentation:
Contains the body of the API response.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • In the returnControlInvocationResults field of the InvokeAgent request

description.documentation: A description for the interactions in the invocation. For example, "User asking about weather in Seattle".

invocationId.documentation: A unique identifier for the invocation in UUID format.

sessionIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier for the associated session for the invocation. You can specify either the session's sessionId or its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp for when the invocation was created.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier for the session associated with the invocation.

encryptionKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use to encrypt the session data. The user or role creating the session must have permission to use the key. For more information, see Amazon Bedrock session encryption.

sessionMetadata.documentation: A map of key-value pairs containing attributes to be persisted across the session. For example, the user's ID, their language preference, and the type of device they are using.

tags.documentation: Specify the key-value pairs for the tags that you want to attach to the session.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp for when the session was created.

sessionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created session.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier for the session.

executor.documentation: The structure of the executor invoking the actions in custom orchestration.

CustomOrchestration.documentation: Contains details of the custom orchestration configured for the agent.

event.documentation: The event details used with the custom orchestration.

traceId.documentation: The unique identifier of the trace.

CustomOrchestrationTrace.documentation: The trace behavior for the custom orchestration.

text.documentation: The text that prompted the event at this step.

CustomOrchestrationTraceEvent.documentation: The event in the custom orchestration sequence. Events are the responses which the custom orchestration Lambda function sends as response to the agent.

agentAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier of an alias of an agent.

agentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the agent to which the alias belongs.

sessionId.documentation: The unique session identifier of the memory.

sessionIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier for the session to be deleted. You can specify either the session's sessionId or its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

resourceName.documentation: The name of the dependency that caused the issue, such as Amazon Bedrock, Lambda, or STS.

DependencyFailedException.documentation: There was an issue with a dependency. Check the resource configurations and retry the request.

sessionIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier for the session to end. You can specify either the session's sessionId or its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

sessionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session you ended.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session you ended.

sessionStatus.documentation: The current status of the session you ended.

byteContent.documentation: The identifier, contentType, and data of the external source wrapper object.

s3Location.documentation: The S3 location of the external source wrapper object.

sourceType.documentation: The source type of the external source wrapper object.

ExternalSource.documentation: The unique external source of the content contained in the wrapper object.

additionalModelRequestFields.documentation: Additional model parameters and their corresponding values not included in the textInferenceConfig structure for an external source. Takes in custom model parameters specific to the language model being used.

inferenceConfig.documentation: Configuration settings for inference when using RetrieveAndGenerate to generate responses while using an external source.

promptTemplate.documentation: Contain the textPromptTemplate string for the external source wrapper object.

ExternalSourcesGenerationConfiguration.documentation: Contains the generation configuration of the external source wrapper object.

generationConfiguration.documentation: The prompt used with the external source wrapper object with the retrieveAndGenerate function.

modelArn.documentation: The model Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the external source wrapper object in the retrieveAndGenerate function.

sources.documentation: The document for the external source wrapper object in the retrieveAndGenerate function.

ExternalSourcesRetrieveAndGenerateConfig.documentation: The configurations of the external source wrapper object in the retrieveAndGenerate function.

FailureTrace.documentation: Contains information about the failure of the interaction.

fieldName.documentation: The name of a metadata field to include in or exclude from consideration when reranking.

FieldForReranking.documentation: Contains information for a metadata field to include in or exclude from consideration when reranking.

files.documentation: Files containing intermediate response for the user.

FilePart.documentation: Contains intermediate response for code interpreter if any files have been generated.

byteContent.documentation: The data and the text of the attached files.

s3Location.documentation: The s3 location of the files to attach.

sourceType.documentation: The source type of the files to attach.

FileSource.documentation: The source file of the content contained in the wrapper object.

key.documentation: The name that the metadata attribute must match.

value.documentation: The value to whcih to compare the value of the metadata attribute.

FilterAttribute.documentation:
Specifies the name that the metadata attribute must match and the value to which to compare the value of the metadata attribute. For more information, see Query configurations.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • RetrieveAndGenerate request

metadata.documentation: Contains information about the invoke agent operation.

text.documentation: The text in the response to the user.

FinalResponse.documentation: Contains details about the response to the user.

FlowCompletionEvent.documentation: Contains information about why a flow completed.

document.documentation: The document content of the field, which can contain text or structured data.

FlowExecutionContent.documentation:
Contains the content of an flow execution input or output field.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

error.documentation: The error code for the type of error that occurred.

message.documentation: A descriptive message that provides details about the error.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the node in the flow where the error occurred (if applicable).

FlowExecutionError.documentation:
Contains information about an error that occurred during an flow execution.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

conditionResultEvent.documentation: Contains information about a condition evaluation result during the flow execution. This event is generated when a condition node in the flow evaluates its conditions.

flowFailureEvent.documentation: Contains information about a failure that occurred at the flow level during execution.

flowInputEvent.documentation: Contains information about the inputs provided to the flow at the start of execution.

flowOutputEvent.documentation: Contains information about the outputs produced by the flow at the end of execution.

nodeFailureEvent.documentation: Contains information about a failure that occurred at a specific node during execution.

nodeInputEvent.documentation: Contains information about the inputs provided to a specific node during execution.

nodeOutputEvent.documentation: Contains information about the outputs produced by a specific node during execution.

FlowExecutionEvent.documentation:
Represents an event that occurred during an flow execution. This is a union type that can contain one of several event types, such as node input and output events; flow input and output events; condition node result events, or failure events.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

fields.documentation: A list of input fields provided to the flow.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the node that receives the inputs.

timestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the inputs are provided.

FlowExecutionInputEvent.documentation:
Contains information about the inputs provided to the flow at the start of a flow execution.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

fields.documentation: A list of output fields produced by the flow.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the node that produces the outputs.

timestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the outputs are produced.

FlowExecutionOutputEvent.documentation:
Contains information about the outputs produced by the flow during a flow execution.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the flow execution was created.

endedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the flow execution ended. This field is only populated when the execution has completed, failed, timed out, or been aborted.

executionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the flow execution.

flowAliasIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow alias used for the execution.

flowVersion.documentation: The version of the flow used for the execution.

status.documentation:
The current status of the flow execution.

Flow executions time out after 24 hours.

FlowExecutionSummary.documentation:
Contains summary information about a flow execution, including its status, timestamps, and identifiers.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

errorCode.documentation: The error code that identifies the type of failure that occurred.

errorMessage.documentation: A descriptive message that provides details about the failure.

FlowFailureEvent.documentation:
Contains information about a failure that occurred at the flow level during a flow execution.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

content.documentation: Contains information about an input into the prompt flow.

nodeInputName.documentation: The name of the input from the flow input node.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the flow input node that begins the prompt flow.

nodeOutputName.documentation: The name of the output from the flow input node that begins the prompt flow.

FlowInput.documentation: Contains information about an input into the prompt flow and where to send it.

document.documentation: The input to send to the prompt flow input node.

FlowInputContent.documentation: Contains information about an input into the flow.

content.documentation: The content of the input field, which can contain text or structured data.

name.documentation: The name of the input field as defined in the flow's input schema.

FlowInputField.documentation:
Represents an input field provided to a flow during a flow execution.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

document.documentation: The requested additional input to send back to the multi-turn flow node.

FlowMultiTurnInputContent.documentation: The content structure containing input information for multi-turn flow interactions.

content.documentation: The content payload containing the input request details for the multi-turn interaction.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the node in the flow that is requesting the input.

nodeType.documentation: The type of the node in the flow that is requesting the input.

FlowMultiTurnInputRequestEvent.documentation: Response object from the flow multi-turn node requesting additional information.

FlowOutputContent.documentation: Contains information about the content in an output from prompt flow invocation.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the flow output node that the output is from.

nodeType.documentation: The type of the node that the output is from.

FlowOutputEvent.documentation: Contains information about an output from prompt flow invoction.

content.documentation: The content of the output field, which can contain text or structured data.

name.documentation: The name of the output field as defined in the flow's output schema.

FlowOutputField.documentation:
Represents an output field produced by a flow during a flow execution.

Flow executions is in preview release for Amazon Bedrock and is subject to change.

accessDeniedException.documentation: The request is denied because of missing access permissions. Check your permissions and retry your request.

badGatewayException.documentation: There was an issue with a dependency due to a server issue. Retry your request.

conflictException.documentation: There was a conflict performing an operation. Resolve the conflict and retry your request.

dependencyFailedException.documentation: There was an issue with a dependency. Check the resource configurations and retry the request.

flowCompletionEvent.documentation: Contains information about why the flow completed.

flowMultiTurnInputRequestEvent.documentation: The event stream containing the multi-turn input request information from the flow.

flowOutputEvent.documentation: Contains information about an output from flow invocation.

flowTraceEvent.documentation: Contains information about a trace, which tracks an input or output for a node in the flow.

internalServerException.documentation: An internal server error occurred. Retry your request.

resourceNotFoundException.documentation: The specified resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN) was not found. Check the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and try your request again.

serviceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the service quota. Resubmit your request later.

throttlingException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the limit. Resubmit your request later.

validationException.documentation: Input validation failed. Check your request parameters and retry the request.

conditionNodeResultTrace.documentation: Contains information about an output from a condition node.

nodeActionTrace.documentation: Contains information about an action (operation) called by a node. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

nodeInputTrace.documentation: Contains information about the input into a node.

nodeOutputTrace.documentation: Contains information about the output from a node.

FlowTrace.documentation: Contains information about an input or output for a node in the flow. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

FlowTraceCondition.documentation: Contains information about a condition that was satisfied. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

satisfiedConditions.documentation: An array of objects containing information about the conditions that were satisfied.

timestamp.documentation: The date and time that the trace was returned.

FlowTraceConditionNodeResultEvent.documentation: Contains information about an output from a condition node. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

trace.documentation: The trace object containing information about an input or output for a node in the flow.

FlowTraceEvent.documentation: Contains information about a trace, which tracks an input or output for a node in the flow. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the node that called the operation.

operationName.documentation: The name of the operation that the node called.

requestId.documentation: The ID of the request that the node made to the operation.

serviceName.documentation: The name of the service that the node called.

timestamp.documentation: The date and time that the operation was called.

FlowTraceNodeActionEvent.documentation: Contains information about an action (operation) called by a node in an Amazon Bedrock flow. The service generates action events for calls made by prompt nodes, agent nodes, and Amazon Web Services Lambda nodes.

FlowTraceNodeInputContent.documentation: Contains the content of the node input. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

fields.documentation: An array of objects containing information about each field in the input.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the node that received the input.

timestamp.documentation: The date and time that the trace was returned.

FlowTraceNodeInputEvent.documentation: Contains information about the input into a node. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

FlowTraceNodeInputField.documentation: Contains information about a field in the input into a node. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

FlowTraceNodeOutputContent.documentation: Contains the content of the node output. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

fields.documentation: An array of objects containing information about each field in the output.

nodeName.documentation: The name of the node that yielded the output.

timestamp.documentation: The date and time that the trace was returned.

FlowTraceNodeOutputEvent.documentation: Contains information about the output from a node. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

FlowTraceNodeOutputField.documentation: Contains information about a field in the output from a node. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

description.documentation: A description of the function and its purpose.

parameters.documentation: The parameters that the agent elicits from the user to fulfill the function.

requireConfirmation.documentation: Contains information if user confirmation is required to invoke the function.

FunctionDefinition.documentation: Defines parameters that the agent needs to invoke from the user to complete the function. Corresponds to an action in an action group.

actionGroup.documentation: The action group that the function belongs to.

actionInvocationType.documentation: Contains information about the function to invoke,

parameters.documentation: A list of parameters of the function.

FunctionInvocationInput.documentation:
Contains information about the function that the agent predicts should be called.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • In the returnControl field of the InvokeAgent response

FunctionParameter.documentation:
Contains information about a parameter of the function.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • In the returnControl field of the InvokeAgent response

actionGroup.documentation: The action group that the function belongs to.

confirmationState.documentation: Contains the user confirmation information about the function that was called.

function.documentation: The name of the function that was called.

responseBody.documentation: The response from the function call using the parameters. The response might be returned directly or from the Lambda function. Specify TEXT or IMAGES. The key of the object is the content type. You can only specify one type. If you specify IMAGES, you can specify only one image. You can specify images only when the function in the returnControlInvocationResults is a computer use action. For more information, see Configure an Amazon Bedrock Agent to complete tasks with computer use tools.

responseState.documentation: Controls the final response state returned to end user when API/Function execution failed. When this state is FAILURE, the request would fail with dependency failure exception. When this state is REPROMPT, the API/function response will be sent to model for re-prompt

FunctionResult.documentation:
Contains information about the function that was called from the action group and the response that was returned.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • In the returnControlInvocationResults of the InvokeAgent request

functions.documentation: A list of functions that each define an action in the action group.

FunctionSchema.documentation: Contains details about the function schema for the action group or the JSON or YAML-formatted payload defining the schema.

queryGenerationInput.documentation: Specifies information about a natural language query to transform into SQL.

transformationConfiguration.documentation: Specifies configurations for transforming the natural language query into SQL.

queries.documentation: A list of objects, each of which defines a generated query that can correspond to the natural language queries.

sql.documentation: An SQL query that corresponds to the natural language query.

GeneratedQuery.documentation: Contains information about a query generated for a natural language query.

textResponsePart.documentation: Contains metadata about a textual part of the generated response that is accompanied by a citation.

GeneratedResponsePart.documentation:
Contains metadata about a part of the generated response that is accompanied by a citation.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • InvokeAgent response â€“ in the generatedResponsePart field

  • RetrieveAndGenerate response â€“ in the generatedResponsePart field

additionalModelRequestFields.documentation: Additional model parameters and corresponding values not included in the textInferenceConfig structure for a knowledge base. This allows users to provide custom model parameters specific to the language model being used.

inferenceConfig.documentation: Configuration settings for inference when using RetrieveAndGenerate to generate responses while using a knowledge base as a source.

promptTemplate.documentation: Contains the template for the prompt that's sent to the model for response generation. Generation prompts must include the $search_results$ variable. For more information, see Use placeholder variables in the user guide.

GenerationConfiguration.documentation:
Contains configurations for response generation based on the knowledge base query results.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • RetrieveAndGenerate request

agentAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier of an alias of an agent.

agentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the agent to which the alias belongs.

maxItems.documentation: The maximum number of items to return in the response. If the total number of results is greater than this value, use the token returned in the response in the nextToken field when making another request to return the next batch of results.

nextToken.documentation: If the total number of results is greater than the maxItems value provided in the request, enter the token returned in the nextToken field in the response in this field to return the next batch of results.

memoryContents.documentation: Contains details of the sessions stored in the memory

nextToken.documentation: If the total number of results is greater than the maxItems value provided in the request, use this token when making another request in the nextToken field to return the next batch of results.

executionIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow execution.

flowAliasIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow alias used for the flow execution.

customerEncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key that's used to encrypt the flow snapshot.

definition.documentation:
The flow definition used for the flow execution, including the nodes, connections, and configuration at the time when the execution started.

The definition returns as a string that follows the structure of a FlowDefinition object.

executionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role that's used by the flow execution.

flowAliasIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow alias used for the flow execution.

flowVersion.documentation: The version of the flow used for the flow execution.

executionIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow execution to retrieve.

flowAliasIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow alias used for the execution.

endedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the flow execution ended. This field is only populated when the execution has completed, failed, timed out, or been aborted.

errors.documentation: A list of errors that occurred during the flow execution. Each error includes an error code, message, and the node where the error occurred, if applicable.

executionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the flow execution.

flowAliasIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow alias used for the execution.

flowVersion.documentation: The version of the flow used for the execution.

startedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the flow execution started.

status.documentation:
The current status of the flow execution.

Flow executions time out after 24 hours.

invocationIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier for the invocation in UUID format.

invocationStepId.documentation: The unique identifier (in UUID format) for the specific invocation step to retrieve.

sessionIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier for the invocation step's associated session. You can specify either the session's sessionId or its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

invocationStep.documentation: The complete details of the requested invocation step.

sessionIdentifier.documentation: A unique identifier for the session to retrieve. You can specify either the session's sessionId or its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp for when the session was created.

encryptionKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Key Management Service key used to encrypt the session data. For more information, see Amazon Bedrock session encryption.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp for when the session was last modified.

sessionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier for the session in UUID format.

sessionMetadata.documentation: A map of key-value pairs containing attributes persisted across the session.

GuardrailAssessment.documentation: Assessment details of the content analyzed by Guardrails.

guardrailIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier for the guardrail.

GuardrailConfigurationWithArn.documentation: The configuration details for the guardrail.

action.documentation: The action placed on the content by the Guardrail filter.

confidence.documentation: The confidence level regarding the content detected in the filter by the Guardrail.

type.documentation: The type of content detected in the filter by the Guardrail.

GuardrailContentFilter.documentation: Details of the content filter used in the Guardrail.

filters.documentation: The filter details of the policy assessment used in the Guardrails filter.

GuardrailContentPolicyAssessment.documentation: The details of the policy assessment in the Guardrails filter.

action.documentation: The action details for the custom word filter in the Guardrail.

match.documentation: The match details for the custom word filter in the Guardrail.

GuardrailCustomWord.documentation: The custom word details for the filter in the Guardrail.

action.documentation: The action details for the managed word filter in the Guardrail.

match.documentation: The match details for the managed word filter in the Guardrail.

type.documentation: The type details for the managed word filter in the Guardrail.

GuardrailManagedWord.documentation: The managed word details for the filter in the Guardrail.

action.documentation: The action of the Guardrail filter to identify and remove PII.

match.documentation: The match to settings in the Guardrail filter to identify and remove PII.

type.documentation: The type of PII the Guardrail filter has identified and removed.

GuardrailPiiEntityFilter.documentation: The Guardrail filter to identify and remove personally identifiable information (PII).

action.documentation: The action details for the regex filter used in the Guardrail.

match.documentation: The match details for the regex filter used in the Guardrail.

name.documentation: The name details for the regex filter used in the Guardrail.

regex.documentation: The regex details for the regex filter used in the Guardrail.

GuardrailRegexFilter.documentation: The details for the regex filter used in the Guardrail.

piiEntities.documentation: The details of the PII entities used in the sensitive policy assessment for the Guardrail.

regexes.documentation: The details of the regexes used in the sensitive policy assessment for the Guardrail.

GuardrailSensitiveInformationPolicyAsses.documentation: The details of the sensitive policy assessment used in the Guardrail.

action.documentation: The action details on a specific topic in the Guardrail.

name.documentation: The name details on a specific topic in the Guardrail.

type.documentation: The type details on a specific topic in the Guardrail.

GuardrailTopic.documentation: The details for a specific topic defined in the Guardrail.

topics.documentation: The topic details of the policy assessment used in the Guardrail.

GuardrailTopicPolicyAssessment.documentation: The details of the policy assessment used in the Guardrail.

action.documentation: The trace action details used with the Guardrail.

inputAssessments.documentation: The details of the input assessments used in the Guardrail Trace.

outputAssessments.documentation: The details of the output assessments used in the Guardrail Trace.

traceId.documentation: The details of the trace Id used in the Guardrail Trace.

GuardrailTrace.documentation: The trace details used in the Guardrail.

customWords.documentation: The custom word details for words defined in the Guardrail filter.

managedWordLists.documentation: The managed word lists for words defined in the Guardrail filter.

GuardrailWordPolicyAssessment.documentation: The assessment details for words defined in the Guardrail filter.

format.documentation: The type of image in the result.

source.documentation: The source of the image in the result.

ImageInput.documentation: Details about an image in the result from a function in the action group invocation. You can specify images only when the function is a computer use action. For more information, see Configure an Amazon Bedrock Agent to complete tasks with computer use tools.

bytes.documentation: The raw image bytes for the image. If you use an Amazon Web Services SDK, you don't need to encode the image bytes in base64.

ImageInputSource.documentation: Details about the source of an input image in the result from a function in the action group invocation.

bytes.documentation: The raw image bytes for the image. If you use an Amazon Web Services SDK, you don't need to encode the image bytes in base64.

s3Location.documentation: The path to the Amazon S3 bucket where the image is stored.

metadataAttributes.documentation: Metadata that can be used in a filter.

ImplicitFilterConfiguration.documentation: Settings for implicit filtering, where a model generates a metadata filter based on the prompt.

textInferenceConfig.documentation: Configuration settings specific to text generation while generating responses using RetrieveAndGenerate.

InferenceConfig.documentation: The configuration for inference settings when generating responses using RetrieveAndGenerate.

maximumLength.documentation: The maximum number of tokens allowed in the generated response.

stopSequences.documentation: A list of stop sequences. A stop sequence is a sequence of characters that causes the model to stop generating the response.

temperature.documentation: The likelihood of the model selecting higher-probability options while generating a response. A lower value makes the model more likely to choose higher-probability options, while a higher value makes the model more likely to choose lower-probability options.

topK.documentation: While generating a response, the model determines the probability of the following token at each point of generation. The value that you set for topK is the number of most-likely candidates from which the model chooses the next token in the sequence. For example, if you set topK to 50, the model selects the next token from among the top 50 most likely choices.

topP.documentation: While generating a response, the model determines the probability of the following token at each point of generation. The value that you set for Top P determines the number of most-likely candidates from which the model chooses the next token in the sequence. For example, if you set topP to 0.8, the model only selects the next token from the top 80% of the probability distribution of next tokens.

InferenceConfiguration.documentation: Specifications about the inference parameters that were provided alongside the prompt. These are specified in the PromptOverrideConfiguration object that was set when the agent was created or updated. For more information, see Inference parameters for foundation models.

files.documentation: Files containing intermediate response for the user.

InlineAgentFilePart.documentation: Contains intermediate response for code interpreter if any files have been generated.

attribution.documentation: Contains citations for a part of an agent response.

bytes.documentation: A part of the agent response in bytes.

InlineAgentPayloadPart.documentation: Contains a part of an agent response and citations for it.

accessDeniedException.documentation: The request is denied because of missing access permissions. Check your permissions and retry your request.

badGatewayException.documentation: There was an issue with a dependency due to a server issue. Retry your request.

chunk.documentation: Contains a part of an agent response and citations for it.

conflictException.documentation: There was a conflict performing an operation. Resolve the conflict and retry your request.

dependencyFailedException.documentation: There was an issue with a dependency. Check the resource configurations and retry the request.

files.documentation: Contains intermediate response for code interpreter if any files have been generated.

internalServerException.documentation: An internal server error occurred. Retry your request.

resourceNotFoundException.documentation: The specified resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN) was not found. Check the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and try your request again.

returnControl.documentation: Contains the parameters and information that the agent elicited from the customer to carry out an action. This information is returned to the system and can be used in your own setup for fulfilling the action.

serviceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the service quota. Resubmit your request later.

throttlingException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the limit. Resubmit your request later.

trace.documentation: Contains information about the agent and session, alongside the agent's reasoning process and results from calling actions and querying knowledge bases and metadata about the trace. You can use the trace to understand how the agent arrived at the response it provided the customer. For more information, see Trace events.

validationException.documentation: Input validation failed. Check your request parameters and retry the request.

InlineAgentResponseStream.documentation: The response from invoking the agent and associated citations and trace information.

invocationId.documentation: The identifier of the action group invocation.

invocationInputs.documentation: A list of objects that contain information about the parameters and inputs that need to be sent into the API operation or function, based on what the agent determines from its session with the user.

InlineAgentReturnControlPayload.documentation:
Contains information to return from the action group that the agent has predicted to invoke.

This data type is used in the InvokeAgent response API operation.

callerChain.documentation: The caller chain for the trace part.

collaboratorName.documentation: The collaborator name for the trace part.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session with the agent.

trace.documentation: Contains one part of the agent's reasoning process and results from calling API actions and querying knowledge bases. You can use the trace to understand how the agent arrived at the response it provided the customer. For more information, see Trace enablement.

InlineAgentTracePart.documentation: Contains information about the agent and session, alongside the agent's reasoning process and results from calling API actions and querying knowledge bases and metadata about the trace. You can use the trace to understand how the agent arrived at the response it provided the customer. For more information, see Trace enablement.

conversationHistory.documentation: Contains the conversation history that persist across sessions.

files.documentation: Contains information about the files used by code interpreter.

invocationId.documentation: The identifier of the invocation of an action. This value must match the invocationId returned in the InvokeInlineAgent response for the action whose results are provided in the returnControlInvocationResults field. For more information, see Return control to the agent developer.

promptSessionAttributes.documentation: Contains attributes that persist across a session and the values of those attributes.

returnControlInvocationResults.documentation:
Contains information about the results from the action group invocation. For more information, see Return control to the agent developer.

If you include this field in the sessionState field, the inputText field will be ignored.

sessionAttributes.documentation: Contains attributes that persist across a session and the values of those attributes.

InlineSessionState.documentation: Contains parameters that specify various attributes that persist across a session or prompt. You can define session state attributes as key-value pairs when writing a Lambda function for an action group or pass them when making an InvokeInlineAgent request. Use session state attributes to control and provide conversational context for your inline agent and to help customize your agent's behavior. For more information, see Control session context

useCase.documentation: Specifies how the source files will be used by the code interpreter.

textPrompt.documentation: Contains information about the text prompt to optimize.

InputPrompt.documentation: Contains information about the prompt to optimize.

reason.documentation: The reason for the exception. If the reason is BEDROCK_MODEL_INVOCATION_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE, the model invocation service is unavailable. Retry your request.

InternalServerException.documentation: An internal server error occurred. Retry your request.

actionGroupInvocationInput.documentation: Contains information about the action group to be invoked.

codeInterpreterInvocationInput.documentation: Contains information about the code interpreter to be invoked.

invocationType.documentation: Specifies whether the agent is invoking an action group or a knowledge base.

knowledgeBaseLookupInput.documentation: Contains details about the knowledge base to look up and the query to be made.

InvocationInput.documentation: Contains information pertaining to the action group or knowledge base that is being invoked.

apiInvocationInput.documentation: Contains information about the API operation that the agent predicts should be called.

functionInvocationInput.documentation: Contains information about the function that the agent predicts should be called.

InvocationInputMember.documentation:
Contains details about the API operation or function that the agent predicts should be called.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • In the returnControl field of the InvokeAgent response

apiResult.documentation: The result from the API response from the action group invocation.

functionResult.documentation: The result from the function from the action group invocation.

InvocationResultMember.documentation:
A result from the invocation of an action. For more information, see Return control to the agent developer and Control session context.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • InvokeAgent request

invocationId.documentation: The unique identifier (in UUID format) for the invocation that includes the invocation step.

invocationStepId.documentation: The unique identifier (in UUID format) for the invocation step.

invocationStepTime.documentation: The timestamp for when the invocation step was created.

payload.documentation: Payload content, such as text and images, for the invocation step.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session containing the invocation step.

InvocationStep.documentation: Stores fine-grained state checkpoints, including text and images, for each interaction in an invocation in a session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

InvocationStepPayload.documentation: Payload content, such as text and images, for the invocation step.

invocationId.documentation: A unique identifier for the invocation in UUID format.

invocationStepId.documentation: The unique identifier (in UUID format) for the invocation step.

invocationStepTime.documentation: The timestamp for when the invocation step was created.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier for the session associated with the invocation step.

InvocationStepSummary.documentation: Contains details about an invocation step within an invocation in a session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp for when the invocation was created.

invocationId.documentation: A unique identifier for the invocation in UUID format.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier for the session associated with the invocation.

InvocationSummary.documentation: Contains details about an invocation in a session. For more information about sessions, see Store and retrieve conversation history and context with Amazon Bedrock sessions.

agentAliasId.documentation: The alias of the agent to use.

agentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the agent to use.

enableTrace.documentation: Specifies whether to turn on the trace or not to track the agent's reasoning process. For more information, see Trace enablement.

endSession.documentation: Specifies whether to end the session with the agent or not.

inputText.documentation:
The prompt text to send the agent.

If you include returnControlInvocationResults in the sessionState field, the inputText field will be ignored.

memoryId.documentation: The unique identifier of the agent memory.

promptCreationConfigurations.documentation: Specifies parameters that control how the service populates the agent prompt for an InvokeAgent request. You can control which aspects of previous invocations in the same agent session the service uses to populate the agent prompt. This gives you more granular control over the contextual history that is used to process the current request.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session. Use the same value across requests to continue the same conversation.

sessionState.documentation:
Contains parameters that specify various attributes of the session. For more information, see Control session context.

If you include returnControlInvocationResults in the sessionState field, the inputText field will be ignored.

sourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the resource making the request.

streamingConfigurations.documentation:
Specifies the configurations for streaming.

To use agent streaming, you need permissions to perform the bedrock:InvokeModelWithResponseStream action.

completion.documentation: The agent's response to the user prompt.

contentType.documentation: The MIME type of the input data in the request. The default value is application/json.

memoryId.documentation: The unique identifier of the agent memory.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session with the agent.

enableTrace.documentation: Specifies whether to return the trace for the flow or not. Traces track inputs and outputs for nodes in the flow. For more information, see Track each step in your prompt flow by viewing its trace in Amazon Bedrock.

executionId.documentation: The unique identifier for the current flow execution. If you don't provide a value, Amazon Bedrock creates the identifier for you.

flowAliasIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the flow alias.

inputs.documentation: A list of objects, each containing information about an input into the flow.

executionId.documentation: The unique identifier for the current flow execution.

responseStream.documentation: The output of the flow, returned as a stream. If there's an error, the error is returned.

actionGroups.documentation: A list of action groups with each action group defining the action the inline agent needs to carry out.

agentCollaboration.documentation: Defines how the inline collaborator agent handles information across multiple collaborator agents to coordinate a final response. The inline collaborator agent can also be the supervisor.

collaboratorConfigurations.documentation: Settings for an inline agent collaborator called with InvokeInlineAgent.

customOrchestration.documentation: Contains details of the custom orchestration configured for the agent.

customerEncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services KMS key to use to encrypt your inline agent.

enableTrace.documentation: Specifies whether to turn on the trace or not to track the agent's reasoning process. For more information, see Using trace.

endSession.documentation: Specifies whether to end the session with the inline agent or not.

foundationModel.documentation: The model identifier (ID) of the model to use for orchestration by the inline agent. For example, meta.llama3-1-70b-instruct-v1:0.

guardrailConfiguration.documentation: The guardrails to assign to the inline agent.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation:
The number of seconds for which the inline agent should maintain session information. After this time expires, the subsequent InvokeInlineAgent request begins a new session.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and the data provided before the timeout is deleted.

inlineSessionState.documentation:
Parameters that specify the various attributes of a sessions. You can include attributes for the session or prompt or, if you configured an action group to return control, results from invocation of the action group. For more information, see Control session context.

If you include returnControlInvocationResults in the sessionState field, the inputText field will be ignored.

inputText.documentation:
The prompt text to send to the agent.

If you include returnControlInvocationResults in the sessionState field, the inputText field will be ignored.

instruction.documentation: The instructions that tell the inline agent what it should do and how it should interact with users.

knowledgeBases.documentation: Contains information of the knowledge bases to associate with.

orchestrationType.documentation: Specifies the type of orchestration strategy for the agent. This is set to DEFAULT orchestration type, by default.

promptCreationConfigurations.documentation: Specifies parameters that control how the service populates the agent prompt for an InvokeInlineAgent request. You can control which aspects of previous invocations in the same agent session the service uses to populate the agent prompt. This gives you more granular control over the contextual history that is used to process the current request.

promptOverrideConfiguration.documentation: Configurations for advanced prompts used to override the default prompts to enhance the accuracy of the inline agent.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session. Use the same value across requests to continue the same conversation.

streamingConfigurations.documentation:
Specifies the configurations for streaming.

To use agent streaming, you need permissions to perform the bedrock:InvokeModelWithResponseStream action.

completion.documentation: The inline agent's response to the user prompt.

contentType.documentation: The MIME type of the input data in the request. The default value is application/json.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session with the agent.

description.documentation: The description of the knowledge base associated with the inline agent.

knowledgeBaseId.documentation: The unique identifier for a knowledge base associated with the inline agent.

retrievalConfiguration.documentation: The configurations to apply to the knowledge base during query. For more information, see Query configurations.

KnowledgeBase.documentation: Details of the knowledge base associated withe inline agent.

knowledgeBaseId.documentation: The unique identifier for a knowledge base attached to the agent.

retrievalConfiguration.documentation: The configurations to apply to the knowledge base during query. For more information, see Query configurations.

KnowledgeBaseConfiguration.documentation: Configurations to apply to a knowledge base attached to the agent during query. For more information, see Knowledge base retrieval configurations.

knowledgeBaseId.documentation: The unique identifier of the knowledge base to look up.

text.documentation: The query made to the knowledge base.

KnowledgeBaseLookupInput.documentation: Contains details about the knowledge base to look up and the query to be made.

metadata.documentation: Contains information about the knowledge base output.

retrievedReferences.documentation: Contains metadata about the sources cited for the generated response.

KnowledgeBaseLookupOutput.documentation: Contains details about the results from looking up the knowledge base.

text.documentation: The text of the query made to the knowledge base.

KnowledgeBaseQuery.documentation:
Contains the query made to the knowledge base.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • Retrieve request â€“ in the retrievalQuery field

vectorSearchConfiguration.documentation: Contains details about how the results from the vector search should be returned. For more information, see Query configurations.

KnowledgeBaseRetrievalConfiguration.documentation:
Contains configurations for knowledge base query. For more information, see Query configurations.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • Retrieve request â€“ in the retrievalConfiguration field

  • RetrieveAndGenerate request â€“ in the retrievalConfiguration field

content.documentation: Contains information about the content of the chunk.

location.documentation: Contains information about the location of the data source.

metadata.documentation: Contains metadata attributes and their values for the file in the data source. For more information, see Metadata and filtering.

score.documentation: The level of relevance of the result to the query.

KnowledgeBaseRetrievalResult.documentation:
Details about a result from querying the knowledge base.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • Retrieve response â€“ in the retrievalResults field

generationConfiguration.documentation: Contains configurations for response generation based on the knowledge base query results.

knowledgeBaseId.documentation: The unique identifier of the knowledge base that is queried.

modelArn.documentation: The ARN of the foundation model or inference profile used to generate a response.

orchestrationConfiguration.documentation: Settings for how the model processes the prompt prior to retrieval and generation.

retrievalConfiguration.documentation: Contains configurations for how to retrieve and return the knowledge base query.

KnowledgeBaseRetrieveAndGenerateConfigur.documentation:
Contains details about the resource being queried.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • Retrieve request â€“ in the knowledgeBaseConfiguration field

  • RetrieveAndGenerate request â€“ in the knowledgeBaseConfiguration field

filter.documentation: Specifies the filters to use on the metadata in the knowledge base data sources before returning results. For more information, see Query configurations.

numberOfResults.documentation: The number of source chunks to retrieve.

overrideSearchType.documentation: By default, Amazon Bedrock decides a search strategy for you.
